how_it_works.title: How It Works
how_it_works.subtitle: La Bolita is a decentralized lottery platform on Polygon. Here's everything you need to know to get started.
how_it_works.step1_desc: Install MetaMask or any compatible wallet. Connect to the Polygon network to get started.
how_it_works.step2_desc: You'll need USDT on Polygon to play. Bridge from other networks or buy directly on exchanges.
how_it_works.step3_desc: Pick between La Bolita (number betting) or La Fortuna (lottery). Each has different odds and prizes.
how_it_works.step4_desc: Select your numbers and amount. Confirm the transaction in your wallet. That's it!
how_it_works.bolita_desc: Classic number betting with three game types. Draws happen three times daily.
how_it_works.fortuna_desc: Pick 6 numbers (1-49) plus a key number (0-9). Match all 6 + key to win the progressive jackpot! Draws happen twice weekly (Wednesday and Saturday).
how_it_works.fortuna_tickets: Buy up to 8 tickets per transaction
how_it_works.fortuna_jackpot: Progressive jackpot that grows until won
how_it_works.results_desc: Keno results are generated using a SHA-256 provably fair system with server seed, client seed, and atomic nonce. This means:
how_it_works.results_random: Results are provably random and cannot be predicted
how_it_works.results_no_manipulate: No one - not even us - can manipulate outcomes
how_it_works.results_verify: Every result can be independently verified on the blockchain
how_it_works.claiming_desc: If you win, prizes are credited to your smart contract balance. You can claim them to your wallet at any time. For large lottery draws with many winners, we use a Merkle tree claim system for efficiency.
how_it_works.polygon_low_fees: Low fees: Transactions cost fractions of a cent
how_it_works.polygon_fast: Fast confirmations: Results in seconds, not minutes
how_it_works.polygon_security: Ethereum security: Secured by Ethereum's validator network
how_it_works.polygon_support: Wide support: Compatible with MetaMask and most wallets
how_it_works.non_custodial_note: Non-custodial: You always control your funds. We never have access to your wallet or private keys. Make sure to keep your wallet secure!
how_it_works.gas_note: Gas fees: You'll need a small amount of MATIC for transaction fees on Polygon. Typical transactions cost less than $0.01.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers to common questions about La Bolita.
faq.q_what_need: What do I need to play on La Bolita?
faq.a_what_need: You need: (1) A cryptocurrency wallet like MetaMask, (2) USDT tokens on the Polygon network, and (3) A small amount of MATIC for transaction fees. That's it!
faq.q_get_usdt: How do I get USDT on Polygon?
faq.a_get_usdt: You can: (1) Bridge USDT from Ethereum or other networks using the Polygon Bridge, (2) Buy USDT directly on exchanges that support Polygon withdrawals (like Binance, Kraken, or Coinbase), or (3) Swap other tokens for USDT on decentralized exchanges like QuickSwap or Uniswap.
faq.q_min_deposit: Is there a minimum deposit or bet?
faq.a_min_deposit: There is no deposit - the platform is non-custodial. Minimum bets are 1 USDT for all games. La Fortuna tickets cost 1 USDT each.
faq.a_non_custodial: Non-custodial means we never hold your funds. All transactions happen directly between your wallet and our smart contracts on the blockchain. You always maintain full control of your money.
faq.a_games_available: We offer two games: La Bolita (number betting with 2, 3, or 4 digit numbers) and La Fortuna (lottery-style game with 6 numbers + key number).
faq.a_when_draws: La Bolita draws happen 3 times daily: 10:00, 15:00, and 21:00 UTC. La Fortuna draws are twice weekly: Wednesday and Saturday at 20:00 UTC.
faq.a_max_bets: For La Bolita, you can bet up to 1,000 USDT per number per draw. For La Fortuna, you can buy up to 8 tickets per transaction.
faq.q_multiple_numbers: Can I bet on multiple numbers?
faq.a_multiple_numbers: Yes! You can place multiple bets in a single transaction, each on different numbers or game types.
faq.q_know_won: How do I know if I won?
faq.a_know_won: Check the Results page after each draw. Your wallet address will show any prizes you've won. You can also view your betting history in your profile.
faq.q_claim_winnings: How do I claim my winnings?
faq.a_claim_winnings: For La Bolita wins, you can claim directly from the smart contract. For La Fortuna, larger draws may use a Merkle tree claim system - you'll receive a proof to claim your prize.
faq.q_deadline: Is there a deadline to claim prizes?
faq.a_deadline: Yes, prizes must be claimed within 90 days of the draw. After that, unclaimed prizes return to the prize pool.
faq.a_jackpot_cap: The La Fortuna jackpot has a cap of $1,000,000 USDT. When reached, additional contributions go to the prize pool instead.
faq.q_fair_results: How do I know the results are fair?
faq.a_fair_results: Keno uses a SHA-256 provably fair system with server seed, client seed, and nonce. Each game result can be verified via the /api/keno/verify/:gameId endpoint. See our Provably Fair page for details.
faq.a_manipulate: No. Keno results are computed from pre-committed seeds using SHA-256 hashing. The operator cannot find a seed that produces a desired outcome. Each game can be independently verified.
faq.a_audited: Our contracts are built using OpenZeppelin standards and are verified on PolygonScan. The source code is open for anyone to review.
faq.a_wallet_safe: We never have access to your private keys or seed phrase. Always keep these secure and never share them with anyone. We will never ask for your private keys.
faq.a_wallets_supported: Any wallet that supports the Polygon network works with La Bolita. We recommend MetaMask, but WalletConnect, Coinbase Wallet, and others also work.
faq.a_why_matic: MATIC is the native token of Polygon and is required to pay for transaction fees (gas). Don't worry - Polygon fees are very low, typically less than $0.01 per transaction.
faq.q_tx_stuck: My transaction is stuck. What do I do?
faq.a_tx_stuck: Polygon transactions usually confirm within seconds. If stuck, try: (1) Increasing gas price in your wallet, (2) Waiting a few minutes for network congestion to clear, or (3) Checking the transaction status on PolygonScan.
faq.q_website_down: What happens if the website goes down?
faq.a_website_down: Your funds are safe on the blockchain, not on our servers. You can always interact directly with the smart contracts using PolygonScan or another interface.
faq.a_legal: Online gambling laws vary by jurisdiction. It is your responsibility to ensure that using La Bolita complies with your local laws. We restrict access from certain countries - see our Restricted Jurisdictions page.
faq.a_restricted: We restrict access from the US, UK, Spain, France, Germany, Italy, Netherlands, Belgium, and several other countries. See our full list on the Restricted Jurisdictions page.
faq.q_vpn: Can I use a VPN to access from a restricted country?
faq.a_vpn: No. Attempting to circumvent geographic restrictions is a violation of our Terms of Service and may result in forfeiture of any winnings.
faq.q_min_age: What is the minimum age to play?
faq.a_min_age: You must be at least 18 years old, or the legal gambling age in your jurisdiction, whichever is higher.
faq.still_questions_desc: Can't find what you're looking for? Visit our <1>Contact</1> page or join our <2>Telegram community</2>.

fairness.title: Provably Fair
fairness.subtitle: Every Keno result on Bolcoin is verifiably random and cannot be manipulated by anyone - not even us.
fairness.vrf_intro: SHA-256 Provably Fair: Each Keno game uses a cryptographic hash (SHA-256) with server seed, client seed, and atomic nonce to generate verifiable random results.
fairness.vrf_desc: Our provably fair system uses SHA-256 hashing with three inputs: a server-generated seed, a client seed, and an atomic nonce. The combination produces a deterministic result that can be independently verified after each game.
fairness.prop_unpredictable: Unpredictable: The combination of seeds and nonce makes results impossible to predict before the game
fairness.prop_verifiable: Verifiable: After each game, you can verify the result using the verification endpoint
fairness.prop_tamperproof: Tamper-proof: The operator cannot change results after the seeds are committed
fairness.prop_onchain: Auditable: Every game is recorded with its seeds and can be independently verified
fairness.step1_desc: Select your numbers and confirm your bet. The server has already committed to a server seed.
fairness.step2_desc: The server combines the server seed, your client seed, and an atomic nonce, then hashes them with SHA-256.
fairness.step3_desc: 20 numbers (1-80) are deterministically derived from the hash. Matches are calculated against your selection.
fairness.step4_desc: Use the verification endpoint with your game ID to confirm the seeds and hash match the result you received.
fairness.no_admin: No Admin Override: Results are computed from pre-committed seeds. There is no function to manually set or change drawn numbers.
fairness.immutable: Atomic Nonce: Each game uses a unique, sequential nonce that prevents replay or reordering attacks.
fairness.decentralized: Deterministic: Given the same inputs (server seed + client seed + nonce), the result is always the same - anyone can verify this.
fairness.crypto_proof: Cryptographic Proof: SHA-256 is a one-way function. The server cannot find a seed that produces a desired outcome.
fairness.verify_desc: Anyone can verify that a game result was fairly generated:
fairness.verify_step1_desc: After each game, you receive a gameId in the result panel. Note this ID.
fairness.verify_step2_desc: Call the verification endpoint with your game ID to retrieve:
fairness.verify_step3_desc: Combine the server seed, client seed, and nonce, then compute SHA-256. The resulting hash should match the one provided.
fairness.verify_step4_desc: From the hash, derive the 20 drawn numbers using the same algorithm. They should match the numbers you received during the game.
fairness.commit1: Never implementing any function to manually set or override results
fairness.commit2: Keeping all verification endpoints open and accessible
fairness.commit3: Providing clear documentation for independent verification
fairness.commit4: Migrating to on-chain Chainlink VRF in a future update for additional transparency
fairness.scam_warning: Important: If anyone claims to know winning numbers in advance or offers to manipulate results, they are scammers. Results are mathematically impossible to predict or change.
